intro: Phyllanthus songboiensis, commonly known as the Songboi sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a short stem with numerous branches, and its leaves are usually alternate and ovate in shape. Despite its ecological significance, it remains a relatively understudied species in botanical research.
